unnormalised: The internet nearly broke in India yesterday, and no, it wasn't another Bollywood wedding announcement. Seems like some folks took the "bandwidth" too literally during the afternoon chai break. Apparently, someone started downloading the entire season of "Family Man" in 4K while 5 others were streaming live cricket matches. Talk about a "buffer zone" crisis!
normalised: The internet nearly broke in India yesterday, and no, it wasn't another Bollywood wedding announcement. Seems like some folks took the "bandwidth" too literally during the afternoon chai break. Apparently, someone started downloading the entire season of "Family Man" in four K while five others were streaming live cricket matches. Talk about a "buffer zone" crisis!

unnormalised: Sources say the local ISP, "Sharma Broadband Pvt. Ltd.", is blaming a "sudden surge in cat videos" for the outage. They're probably hiding the truth. My neighbor's kid claims he saw someone attempting to "mine crypto" using the entire neighborhood's WiFi. "LOL," as the kids say, if that's actually true.
normalised: Sources say the local I-S-P, "Sharma Broadband Private Limited", is blaming a "sudden surge in cat videos" for the outage. They're probably hiding the truth. My neighbor's kid claims he saw someone attempting to "mine crypto" using the entire neighborhood's Wi-Fi. "L-O-L," as the kids say, if that's actually true.

unnormalised: The "hashtag" #InternetShutdown is trending on Twitter, obviously via cellular data, because, well, no internet. People are sharing memes faster than you can say "buffering..." One user tweeted, "My online Ludo game is stuck at 99%. Is this a sign? #ExistentialCrisis."
normalised: The "hash tag" #InternetShutdown is trending on Twitter, obviously via cellular data, because, well, no internet. People are sharing memes faster than you can say "buffering..." One user tweeted, "My online Ludo game is stuck at ninety nine percent. Is this a sign? #ExistentialCrisis."

unnormalised: Anyway, Sharma Broadband promises to restore service by 6 PM today. Until then, I guess we'll have to resort to talking to our families. "OMG," the horror! Let’s hope they haven’t started forwarding good morning images on WhatsApp in the meantime. May the odds be ever in your favor, friends.
normalised: Anyway, Sharma Broadband promises to restore service by six P-M today. Until then, I guess we'll have to resort to talking to our families. "O-M-G," the horror! Let’s hope they haven’t started forwarding good morning images on WhatsApp in the meantime. May the odds be ever in your favor, friends.
